revision_content.description: Covers all essential subtopics under 'Numbers' in Grade 9 Mathematics with definitions, relatable examples, why-it-matters, and helpful revision tips.

subtopics.title: Natural Numbers
subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in counting and ordering real-life items.

subtopics.title: Whole Numbers
subtopics.whyItMatters: Useful when 0 is a valid value (e.g., bank balance = 0).

subtopics.title: Integers
subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in temperature, debts, elevation, etc.

subtopics.title: Rational Numbers
subtopics.definition: Can be written as a fraction a/b (b ≠ 0).
subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in pricing, budgeting, and calculations.

subtopics.title: Irrational Numbers
subtopics.definition: Numbers that cannot be written as a simple fraction.

example.question: Is √2 irrational?
example.answer: Yes, because it doesn't end or repeat.

subtopics.whyItMatters: Common in geometry and real-world measurements.
quickTips: Decimals go on forever with no pattern.

subtopics.title: Real Numbers
subtopics.definition: All rational and irrational numbers combined.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Covers every number used in school maths.
quickTips: Every number on a number line is real.

subtopics.title: Even and Odd Numbers
subtopics.definition: Even: divisible by 2; Odd: not divisible by 2.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Important in number patterns and factorization.

subtopics.title: Prime Numbers
subtopics.definition: Natural numbers > 1 with exactly two factors.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Building blocks of all numbers via prime factorization.

subtopics.title: Composite Numbers
subtopics.definition: Natural numbers that have more than two factors.

subtopics.title: LCM (Least Common Multiple)
subtopics.definition: The smallest number that two or more numbers divide evenly.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in aligning fractions, calendars, schedules.
quickTips: Use prime factorization or listing method.

subtopics.title: HCF (Highest Common Factor)
subtopics.definition: The largest number that divides two or more numbers exactly.
quickTips: Use prime factors or ladder method.

subtopics.title: Number Properties
subtopics.definition: Rules that define how numbers work with operations.

example.question: a + b = b + a is what property?

subtopics.whyItMatters: Helps simplify and solve complex problems.

subtopics.title: BODMAS/BIDMAS
subtopics.definition: Order of operations for solving math expressions.

subtopics.title: Scientific Notation
subtopics.definition: Way of writing very big or small numbers using powers of 10.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Useful in science and large data handling.

subtopics.title: Standard Form
subtopics.definition: The regular way of writing numbers.

subtopics.title: Rounding and Estimation
subtopics.definition: Approximating a number to make calculations easier.
subtopics.whyItMatters: Used in shopping, time estimation, budgeting.
quickTips: Check the digit after the place you're rounding.
